Construct a cell neighborhood glyph

Source: R/neighborhoodArcGlyph.R
neighborhoodArcGlyph.Rd

Generate a topology-aware glyph that visually encodes a cell neighborhood by combining cell types, regions, and their adjacency structure into a compact graphical representation.

Usage

neighborhoodArcGlyph(
  string,
  adjmat,
  delimiter_node = "--",
  delimiter_region_celltype = "_",
  region_color_plate = NULL,
  celltype_color_plate,
  dummy_arc_color = c(dummy = "gray"),
  arc_position = c(0, 0),
  arc_radius = c(1, 0.9),
  arc_scale = c(0.7, 1),
  arc_angle = c(3 * pi/10, 7 * pi/10),
  arc_length_out = 100,
  arc_width = 3,
  arc_text_color = "default",
  arc_text_x = c(0.7, 0.7),
  arc_text_y = c(0.9, 0.7),
  arc_text_size = 4,
  arc_text_fontface = "plain",
  node_scale = list(c(0.4, 0.4), c(0.4, 0.4)),
  node_xjust = c(0, 0),
  node_yjust = c(1.3, 0.6),
  network_edge_color = "black",
  node_text_size = 3,
  node_text_hjust = 0.5,
  node_text_vjust = 0.5,
  node_text_fontface = "plain",
  xlims = c(-1, 1),
  ylims = c(0, 2)
)

Arguments

string

A character string encoding neighborhood nodes. Nodes are separated by delimiter_node, and each node encodes region and cell type separated by delimiter_region_celltype.

adjmat

An adjacency matrix specifying the neighborhood topology between nodes.

delimiter_node

A character delimiter used to separate nodes in string. Default is "--".

delimiter_region_celltype

A character delimiter used to split region and cell type within a node. Default is "_".

region_color_plate

A named character vector specifying colors for each region.

celltype_color_plate

A named character vector specifying colors for each cell type.

dummy_arc_color

A named character vector specifying the color used for a dummy region arc when only a single region is present. In this case, the dummy arc serves as a placeholder to indicate that all cell types are contained within the same region. Default is gray.

arc_position

A numeric vector of length 2 specifying the (x, y) center of the glyph.

arc_radius

A numeric vector specifying inner and outer arc radii. Default is c(1, 0.9).

arc_scale

A numeric vector of length 2 specifying x- and y-axis scaling factors applied to arc geometry. Default is c(0.7, 1).

arc_angle

A numeric vector of length 2 specifying the angular positions (in radians) used to place region-specific arcs. Each value corresponds to one region. Default is c(3*pi/10, 7*pi/10).

arc_length_out

Integer specifying the number of points used to approximate each arc.

arc_width

Numeric specifying the line width of arcs.

arc_text_color

Character specifying text color for region labels. Use "default" to inherit region colors.

arc_text_x

A numeric vector specifying x positions for region text labels.

arc_text_y

A numeric vector specifying y positions for region text labels.

arc_text_size

Numeric specifying text size for region labels.

arc_text_fontface

Character specifying font face for region labels.

node_scale

A list of numeric vectors of length 2 specifying x- and y-axis scaling factors for node placement. Each list element corresponds to one region.

node_xjust

A numeric vector specifying horizontal offsets applied to node positions, one per region.

node_yjust

A numeric vector specifying vertical offsets applied to node positions, one per region.

network_edge_color

Character specifying color for network edges.

node_text_size

Numeric specifying text size for node labels.

node_text_hjust

Numeric specifying horizontal justification applied to node text labels.

node_text_vjust

Numeric specifying vertical justification applied to node text labels.

node_text_fontface

Character specifying font face for node labels.

xlims

Numeric vector specifying x-axis limits for the glyph.

ylims

Numeric vector specifying y-axis limits for the glyph.

Value

A ggplot object representing the cell neighborhood glyph.

Details

This function integrates node parsing, topology encoding, and geometric layout to construct a compact glyph representation of a cell neighborhood. It is intended for summarizing local spatial structures rather than precise spatial coordinates.

On this page

Developed by Huimin Wang.
